The Roadblocks For Cloud Gaming In Canada

Our project focuses on Cloud Gaming and the roadblocks it faces within Canada. As we know, Canada is the second largest country in the world, but all 9.98 million square kilometers of Canada is not the same, and neither is the technology available. We are going to explore the challenges that come with cloud gaming in Canada, and how we, as a country, can possibly overcome them. We will be looking at the current technological divide within Canada and how we can bridge the gap between the haves and the have-nots. To truly understand the issue, we are using the Who, What, Where, When, Why, and How framework to dive into the challenges cloud gaming faces in Canada.

  1. The Who

    Explore who is impacted by the lack of connectivity and/or the technological divide in Canada. This includes the demographics of the impacted individuals, and the impact on their lives. Learning who can and cannot access technology required for cloud gaming will help us understand the scope of the issue.

    Explore
  2. The What

    Identify the current state of connectivity and technology in Canada. This includes the current technological capabilities and the current state of the gaming industry in Canada. Explaining how cloud connectivity is achieved and maintained along with showcasing the current connectivity and cloud infrastructure within the country. Understanding what the problem is will help us understand how it affects Canadians and how to solve it.

    Explore
  3. The Where

    Uncover areas where these issues exist, as well as exploring the reasons behind these issues. Understanding the vast size of Canada in comparison to larger metropolitan areas within it will provide an overview of how widespread these issues are. Although Canada has several major cities, there are also many smaller cities and rural areas.

    Explore
  4. The When

    Look at the timeline of technological advancements in Canada, and how they impacted different areas. Explore future projects spearheaded by the Canadian Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission aimed at connecting more Canadians and expanding broadband internet coverage. Also, review future cloud technology advancements within Canada and their potential to solve these problems.

    Explore
  5. The Why

    Understand why these problems exist. This includes the historical context of the technological divide in Canada, and the current impact it has on families and communities. These issues were highlighted during the COVID-19 pandemic, as families relied on technology more than ever, revealing a lack of access to reliable internet. Understanding the root of the problem will help us find solutions.

    Explore
  6. The How

    Explore how Canadians can bridge the technological divide and improve connectivity in rural areas. This includes looking at the current infrastructure and finding ways to make cloud gaming accessible to everyone in Canada. Additionally, review current technological advancements and their potential to improve connectivity, making cloud gaming a possibility for more Canadians.

    Explore
